snippet: The database contains calls between the United States and abroad as part of an effort to catch drug traffickers — but data was collected on people not involved in criminal activity.
abstract: Justice Dept reveals prior existence of Drug Enforcement Administration database that had contained American telephone records, adding new details to disclosures about mass government surveillance.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MATT APUZZO

lead_paragraph: The database contains calls between the United States and abroad as part of an effort to catch drug traffickers — but data was collected on people not involved in criminal activity.

headline.main: U.S. Discloses New Trove of Phone Call Records
headline.print_headline: U.S. Discloses New Trove of Phone Call Records
